title: Moving Your Body
description: Exercise is a celebration of what your body can do. A consistent routine improves cardiovascular health, builds strength, reduces stress, and boosts mental clarity.
sentences: Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity cardio per week (e.g., brisk walking, cycling).
Incorporate strength training 2-3 times a week to build muscle and bone density.
Flexibility and mobility work, like stretching or yoga, is crucial for preventing injuries.
Rest and recovery are just as important as the workout itself.
The best exercise is the one you enjoy and will stick with.
dos: Schedule your workouts in your calendar like appointments.
Find a workout buddy or community for accountability.
Warm up properly before exercising and cool down afterward.
Listen to your body and take rest days when needed.
donts: Don't sacrifice proper form for heavier weights or speed.
Don't expect to see results overnight; consistency is key.
Don't compare your fitness level to others.
Don't skip rest days; they are essential for muscle repair.
